name: AccessibilityTextContentType
desc: Textual context that assistive technologies can use to improve the presentation of spoken text.

items.name: static let console: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents text used for input, like in the Terminal app.

items.name: static let fileSystem: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents text used by a file browser, like in the Finder app in macOS.

items.name: static let messaging: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents text used in a message, like in the Messages app.

items.name: static let narrative: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents text used in a story or poem, like in the Books app.

items.name: static let plain: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents generic text that has no specific type.

items.name: static let sourceCode: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents text used in source code, like in Swift Playgrounds.

items.name: static let spreadsheet: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents text used in a grid of data, like in the Numbers app.

items.name: static let wordProcessing: AccessibilityTextContentType
items.desc: A type that represents text used in a document, like in the Pages app.
